title: ResponsePlan
subtitle: Made by Team Map n' Cheese

splash.splashContent:
Welcome to ReponsePlan.

This app works as your guide for decision making during emergencies or natural disasters. Search for nearby emergency services, community offered help, and local hazards.

To best use our app. enter your location on the left hand side of the map and apply filters for distance from you and locations. The app will provide with options of places to go to and directions to get there. The count widget gives a total number of hazards in your area. The charts give you the amounts of different types of hazards and help in your area. The app can also be shared easily with friends or family, or embedded in a website, allowing easier/more widespread access to ResponsePlan information

If you would like to help make your community a better place and update our map, please feel free to fill out the surveys below:

Community Helper Survey

Hazard Reporter

For more information about this app and to get links on emergency preparedness, please see our about section below.

This map was created by Team Map n' Cheese from the Centre of Geographic Sciences.

parts.displaySQL: building_type IN ('community center','church','fire station','hospital','police station','town hall')

filter.displaySQL: building_type IN ('community center','church','fire station','hospital','police station','town hall')

parts.displaySQL: hazard_type IN ('Flooding','Fire','Road washout','Vehicle wreck','Chemical spill','Debris field','Downed power line','Damaged building','Dangerous animal sighting')
parts.expr: hazard_type IN ('Flooding','Fire','Road washout','Vehicle wreck','Chemical spill','Debris field','Downed power line','Damaged building','Dangerous animal sighting')

filter.expr: hazard_type IN ('Flooding','Fire','Road washout','Vehicle wreck','Chemical spill','Debris field','Downed power line','Damaged building','Dangerous animal sighting')

config.editorDescription: Search for emergency services, local hazards, or community help

about.aboutContent:
**In the event of an emergency, please call 911 first. This app is not a replacement for making a call to emergency services if you are in need of urgent help.**


Welcome to ResponsePlan. Many people don’t have a plan when there is an emergency or a natural disaster especially in an area that they may be unfamiliar with. This app aims to help decision making during an emergency by providing the option for you to input your location and find the closest emergency services, community help, or local hazards as well as optimize directions to to those locations. If you would like to add to our crowd-sourced map you can fill out the following surveys:


The Community Helper Survey exists so that the community can offer support during times of need or emergency. In filling out the survey you can share the location of and type of help you are offering. The survey can be filled out by clicking here: Community Helper Survey


If you would like to report local hazards in your area or mark that hazards have been resolved, you can use the following link to update our map: Hazard Reporter


This app was created by Team Map n’ Cheese from COGS for the 2022 ESRI App Challenge.

The best way to deal with an emergency is to be prepared for it in advance. This section provides links to websites and guides on alerts, how to prepare for an emergency and non-emergency police and ambulance phone numbers for the entire province of Nova Scotia

Nova Scotia Alerts and Emergency Preparedness

Government of Canada Emergency and Natural Disaster Resource

Government of Canada Emergency Preparedness Guide

Government of Canada Nova Scotia Regional Hazards

Government of Canada Emergency Preparedness PDF

Non-Emergency Phone Numbers for Nova Scotia
